items.description: When one aims for a ready-to-run LaTeX environment without installing, Docker images might be the choice.
minimal TeXLive system with package installation possibility

items.description: debian-based full TeXLive system
items.title: Island of TeX/texlive

items.description: debian-based full TeXLive system with additions with pandoc, perl, and python pre-installed
items.title: dante-ev/docker-texlive
Docker Images

items.description: These editors are no one-trick ponies: sure, they edit LaTeX, but they can do a lot more!

children.description: Atom port of the Sublime Text package of the same name.
children.title: LaTeXTools

children.description: Free LaTeX plugin for Sublime Text.
children.title: LaTeXTools

children.description: Emacs plugin for LaTeX that also shows a preview of equations and figures.
children.title: AucTeX

children.description: Emacs plugin for LaTeX that adds support for labels, references, and citations.
children.title: RefTeX

children.description: Modern vim plugin for editing LaTeX files. Has a variety of features including live preview and forward search.
children.title: vimtex

children.description: Free LaTeX plugin for IntelliJ IDEA.
children.title: TeXiFy-IDEA

children.description: LaTeX extension for Visual Studio Code
children.title: LaTeX Workshop

children.description: Devcontainer setup for easy LaTeX usage without local installation
children.title: a-nau/latex-devcontainer

items.title: General purpose text editors

items.description: Online editors that allow you to edit documents collaboratively.
Community-maintained list of popular online LaTeX editor including equation editors.
items.title: List of popular online LaTeX editors

items.description: Online editor with built-in git support and bibliography tools.
items.title: Authorea

items.description: Online editor with realtime collaboration features.
items.title: Crixet

items.description: Online editor, no-signup hybrid code editor + visual editor that mixes Notion/Google docs/Microsoft Word-like editing with raw LaTeX code blocks.
items.title: Modern LaTeX Editor

items.description: Online editor with AI writing assistance.
items.title: Octree

children.description: Command-line interface for Overleaf to sync, manage, and compile projects from the terminal.
children.title: olcli

items.description: Online editor, also with a WYSIWYM editor and git support.
items.title: Overleaf

items.description: Web-based vscode with Git Integration + Copilot + Grammar & Spell Checker + Live Collaboration Support based on GitHub Codespace and Dev container.
items.title: WebLaTeX

items.description: Online editor with built-in git support.
items.title: Papeeria

items.description: Online LaTeX editor with Live Preview and nice presentation mode.
items.title: JaxEdit

items.description: Online diagram editor with built-in LaTeX equation support including live preview and easy exports.
items.title: Vexlio
Online editors

items.description: Very powerful cross-platform (Java) bibtex editor.
items.title: JabRef

items.description:
Extremely customizable,
powerful and simple cross-platform (Python) library manager. It has a very
complete Command-Line-Interface, several GUIs and scripting capability.
items.title: Papis

items.description: Great bibliography editor for .
items.title: Bibdesk

items.description: Reference manager for your browser that also exports to bibtex and integrates with many LaTeX editors.
items.title: Zotero

items.description: Both an app and cloud client to manage your references and PDFs. Can sync out to a bibtex file for your LaTeX workflow.
items.title: Mendeley

items.description: Command-line utility for improving your BibTeX files. Fetches information from online sources.
items.title: betterbib

items.description: Universal citation management and academic reference toolkit that converts messy references into perfectly formatted citations. Supports DOI, arXiv ID, titles, and more, with output in BibTeX, APA, and MLA formats.
items.title: OneCite

items.description: GitHub Action to compile LaTeX documents
items.title: xu-cheng/latex-action

items.description: DANTE e.V.'s GitHub action to compile LaTeX documents. Offers a full TeXLive and pre-installed perl and python.
items.title: dante-ev/latex-action

items.description: Linter / code checker for LaTeX documents.
items.title: ChkTeX

items.description: Command-line tool that replaces commonly occurring LaTeX anti-patterns and cleans up your files.
items.title: blacktex

items.description: A cross-platform (Java) spelling, grammar and style checker for LaTeX documents.
items.title: TeXtidote

items.description: also: ) - WYSIWYG and text-based editor for TikZ pictures.
items.title: TikzEdt

items.description: Live-previewing editor for TikZ figures.
items.title: TikZ-Editor

items.description: Drawing tool that integrates well with LaTeX commands and documents.
items.title: IPE

items.description: Cross-platform geometry tool with output to TikZ.
items.title: GeoGebra

items.description: Cross-platform diagramming tool that can export to PSTricks and MetaPost code.
items.title: Dia

items.description: GUI tool for creating graphs and string diagrams using PGF/TikZ.
items.title: TikZiT

items.description: Vector-based drawing tool having LaTeX as first-class citizen.
items.title: LaTeXDraw

items.description: PSTricks is a great library to draw figures for inclusion in PostScript/DVI files.
items.title: PSTricks

items.description:
TikZ is an awesome package with many plugins that allow you to create figures from within your LaTeX documents.
Typically, it is easier to get to work with than PSTricks is.
Blog about LaTeX, with a big collection of TikZ figures.
items.title: TeXample

items.description: Useful website with some custom packages to draw special plots (Bode, Nyquist, electrical schematics, block schematics, etc.) using TikZ. Note that everything is in French.
items.title: LaTeX en SI

items.description: Truly awesome plotting library on top of and in the style of TikZ/pgf. This library can load in CSV data files, perform some calculations and create beautiful plots.
items.title: pgfplots

items.description: Short introductory document to the world of TikZ, written by Jacques Crémer.
items.title: A very minimal introduction to TikZ (PDF)

items.description: Collection of publication-ready PGF/TikZ figures by Petar Veličković.
items.title: PetarV-/TikZ

items.description: Convert your MATLAB plots to PGFPlots/TikZ.
items.title: matlab2tikz

items.description: Convert your matplotlib plots to PGFPlots/TikZ.
items.title: tikzplotlib

items.description: Step-by-Step Tutorials about How to Draw Illustrations in LaTeX.
items.title: TikZBlog
TikZ

items.description: Collection of templates for papers, posters, resumés, theses, books, presentations, … for LaTeX.

items.description: A typographically elegant, clean, and structured LaTeX template (primarily intended for theses).

items.description: If you want to contribute, please do read our CONTRIBUTING guidelines.

items.description:
The icons indicating Mac, Linux and Windows compatibility show when a program is only available for those platforms. So absence of those icons means that the software is fully cross-platform.
All trademarks are property of their respective owners.
